intro: Clidemia quinquenervia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with five distinct leaf veins. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia quinquenervia is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
